proj78.xml
Class XmlDomImplementation

java.lang.Object
  proj78.xml.XmlDomImplementation

public class XmlDomImplementation
extends java.lang.Object

Provides methods that are independent of any particular instance of the DOM.

Author:
K.A., copyright (c) 2008

Method Detail

createDocument

public XmlDocument createDocument()
(non-DOM) Creates a new instance of the XmlDocument class.

Returns:
a new XmlDocument instance.
See Also:
createDocument(java.lang.String, proj78.xml.XmlDocumentType)

createDocument

public XmlDocument createDocument(java.lang.String tagName,
                                  XmlDocumentType doctype)
Creates a new instance of the XmlDocument class.

Parameters:
tagName - the tag name of the root element that will be created together with the document.
doctype - the type of document to be created; optional and may be null.
Returns:
a new XmlDocument instance with the specified root element and doctype.
Throws:
XmlException - INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: if the tag name is empty, or contains an invalid or illegal XML character.
WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR: if the specified doctype node is already associated with another document.
Since:
DOM Level 2

createXmlDeclaration

public XmlDeclaration createXmlDeclaration(java.lang.String version)
(non-DOM) Creates a new instance of the XmlDeclaration class.

Parameters:
version - the version of XML in use; always the string "1.0".
Returns:
a new XmlDeclaration instance with the specified version.
Throws:
XmlException - NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: if the version string is something other than "1.0".

createXmlDeclaration

public XmlDeclaration createXmlDeclaration(java.lang.String version,
                                           java.lang.String encoding)
(non-DOM) Creates a new instance of the XmlDeclaration class.

Parameters:
version - the version of XML in use; always the string "1.0".
encoding - the character encoding in use.
Returns:
a new XmlDeclaration instance with the specified version and character encoding.
Throws:
XmlException - NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: if the version string is something other than "1.0"; or an unsupported character encoding is specified.

createXmlDeclaration

public XmlDeclaration createXmlDeclaration(java.lang.String version,
                                           java.lang.String encoding,
                                           java.lang.String standalone)
(non-DOM) Creates a new instance of the XmlDeclaration class.

Parameters:
version - the version of XML in use; always the string "1.0".
encoding - the character encoding in use.
standalone - the standalone designation of the document; either "yes" or "no".
Returns:
a new XmlDeclaration instance with the specified version, character encoding, and standalone designation.
Throws:
XmlException - NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: if the version string is something other than "1.0"; or an unsupported character encoding is specified.
INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: if the standalone attribute contains a value other than "yes" or "no".

createDocumentType

public XmlDocumentType createDocumentType(java.lang.String dtdName)
(non-DOM) Creates a new instance of the XmlDocumentType class.

Parameters:
dtdName - the name immediately following the DOCTYPE keyword.
Returns:
a new XmlDocumentType instance with the specified name.
Throws:
XmlException - INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: if the specified name is empty, or contains an invalid or illegal XML character.

createDocumentType

public XmlDocumentType createDocumentType(java.lang.String dtdName,
                                          java.lang.String publicId,
                                          java.lang.String systemId)
Creates a new instance of the XmlDocumentType class.

Parameters:
dtdName - the name immediately following the DOCTYPE keyword.
publicId - the public identifier of the external subset; optional and may be null.
systemId - the system identifier of the external subset; optional and may be null.
Returns:
a new XmlDocumentType instance with the specified name, and public and system identifiers.
Throws:
XmlException - INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: if the specified name is empty, or contains an invalid or illegal XML character.
Since:
DOM Level 2

createDocumentType

public XmlDocumentType createDocumentType(java.lang.String dtdName,
                                          java.lang.String publicId,
                                          java.lang.String systemId,
                                          java.lang.String internalSubset)
(non-DOM) Creates a new instance of the XmlDocumentType class.

Parameters:
dtdName - the name immediately following the DOCTYPE keyword.
publicId - the public identifier of the external subset; optional and may be null.
systemId - the system identifier of the external subset; optional and may be null.
internalSubset - a string containing the internal subset; optional and may be null.
Returns:
a new XmlDocumentType instance with the specified name, public and system identifers, and internal subset.
Throws:
XmlException - INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR: if the specified name is empty, or contains an invalid or illegal XML character.

hasFeature

public boolean hasFeature(java.lang.String feature,
                          java.lang.String version)
Determines whether the DOM supports a given feature.

Parameters:
feature - the name of the feature to test for.
version - the version number of that feature. If a version number is not specified (null), any supported version of that feature will return true.
Returns:
true if the feature is supported, false otherwise.
